author: Liaison67
title: Sinus problems
body: Having issues for over two years and was referred by my GP over a year ago. Finally received a telephone appointment of all things, which lasted 5 minutes in total, to be told I would be sent for a CT scan and then a follow up appointment face to face. The appointment duly arrived and I attended but this was around two months ago. No communication since then and no results. Phone call today to enquire when this would happen, only to be told I am on another waiting list. I was asked if I would like a telephone call to hear my results. My answer was yes, but I thought that this would happen routinely as good practice. Had I realised I had to ask, I would have phoned weeks ago to get put on that waiting list. I can appreciate the whole COVID thing, having worked through the whole thing, and still managing to provide safe face to face patient care.

author: saturnpk74
title: My Father
body: My father was admitted to GRI Emergency Department after a collapse at home where he fell downstairs. He was seen in a prompt manner by Dr Dignan who carried out a full examination of my father. After several investigations, he was diagnosed with a pelvic fracture and admission to a ward was arranged for further management of his care. The Emergency dept team kept us fully informed throughout and showed such great compassion in their care. We send our thanks to everyone involved in his care and thank you all for the tremendous job you do.

author: SKYPE
title: Helping distressed visitor.
body:
a lady attending the RGH site was parking her car while her wheel had buckled and snapped off, three of the carpark operatives assisted this lady and tried to comfort her and calm her down then began traffic management as her vehicle was causing disruption to other users at the site.  
all operatives were very professional and went above and beyond to help this lady and others attending.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: better layout of carpark at he royal site

author: Muzz
title: The caring, courtesy and  commitment of staff at NNUH
body: I had a total hysterectomy in September 2020. The skill, care and dedication of the surgeon and his team were of the highest standard. I see the surgeon every four months. I have scans as well. I had a scan this morning. The whole process was painless and professional. The practioner who looked after me was reassuring and caring. She took an interest in me and made me feel that I was not just another appointment but a human being. I feel so very cared for when I go to the NNUH. I feel so very lucky to have the very best of the NHS caring for my health. I know that at times NHS staff are abused and insulted by some elements of the public. That they can still have the humour and empathy, the courtesy and caring shows, to me that they are very special and totally professional. Thank you.

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: CTCB
title: ICATS- Orthopaedics
body: A massive thank you to Physio Ann who took my concerns seriously after disappointing GP input. Your care and hard work are very much appreciated!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Worried father
title: sons poor treatment in accident and emergency
body:
I had to take my son to accident and emergency on september last year after he tore his ligaments, initially we were ignored by the reception staff for 20 minutes while they had a discussion between themselves, eventually when i finally got their attention after waiting patiently the manner of the staff on duty was dismissive despite it being plainly ovbvious my son was in excruciating pain.  
They then said they were too busy and my son should go home and take paracetamol! He was eventually seen the following morning after spending the night in agony and unable to sleep. Its now april and he is still waiting on an operation, his life and university course is now on hold until then and his mental health deteriorates by every passing day. I understand that these are unprecedented times for the nhs but when some frontline staff don't show compassion for people who are injured and ill we really are in dark times.

author: charaxe49
title: Accident requiring surgery
body:
I visited A&E in September last year, my 21 year old son had a fall and hurt his knee. He was in agony and unable to walk. We were told the wait was 11hrs and he should go home and return next day. He returned at 7am next morning and was given an xray and a brace no pain killers but advised to take ibuprofen and see GP if any concerns. He was told he would be contacted by a virtual orthopaedic clinic. We were contacted by an orthopaedic nurse two days later who gave conflicting advice from hospital as they said don't take ibuprofen, they couldn't answer our questions we didn't know if it was best he put weight on it, or rest it, the nurse just kept repeating it would depend on how stable the knee was, but we didn't know what that meant. We came off phone, confused and frustrated as we had no idea what was happening.  
My son attended a clinic appointment in Monklands a couple of weeks later, he was sent for MRI that day and had to attend physio that day also. There was a sense of panic and we could tell something was wrong. He was later told his knee would require surgery for a ACL injury. My son is unable to walk any distance as the knee gives way randomly, he is a musician and was in his 3rd year at university, he has had to take a year our, give up his job and stay at home whilst he awaits surgery.We have been so sympathetic to the situation going on in hospitals due to covid and staffing issues, so we have been patient and just awaiting a letter. However come March we had heard nothing, my son is still in pain, on regular medication, and is unable to go about his life normally. So we thought we would give hospital a phone for update. He was told he was a priority but also that he wasn't on the schedule which had been done until 21st March, so to give them a call back then. I explained we would take a cancellation, any day, any where as his life is basically on hold. It has been 6mths and I fear for his mental health as its been awful for him not being able to get on with life like a normal 21 year old.  
I called back today, to be told he is not scheduled for surgery and they cannot give me an idea of when as surgeries as present are canceled once more. My son was devastated by this, he is hoping to return to university in September, return to work by the summer but it is looking less likely as time goes on.  
What made today worse is when I commented on a local group for ACL injuries I read that someone got their surgery 2 weeks ago, they only had their accident six weeks ago but apparently they called coordinator and explained how their daughter's schooling and mental health was being impacted and this was seen as a priority. Surely a young man who's life has been turned upside, who has been unable to continue his education and is unable to walk without pain or fear of falling should also be a priority.  
From the start we have been messed around,from that first visit to a&e when we were advised to go home, to the virtual appointment that was unable to answer any of our questions. To now being told, that he has been on the waiting list the longest but there is no date for his surgery. How long will this continue?

title: Went out of their way to help me
body: I have always found this surgery to be incredibly flexible and helpful to me. Recently, they went out of their way to help me when I had an urgent problem with my covid pass. Thank you to the angel that helped me, and to A at reception who was so kind

title: Fantastic service delivered with a smike
body: Being very new to the area I fell quite unwell but had not yet registered with a gp.  Their telephone advice was helpful and in visiting the reception in Thorpe I experienced great customer service from one of the reception staff.  It was a far better service than I have ever received in London.  Thanks again

title: Empathetic practice
body:
I was delighted with the care I received from two GP's at this practice. At a time when I needed a listening ear and some reflective conversation, I got exactly that.
Thank you so much for your guidance and knowledge based recommendations and advice.

author: Sharond1984
title: Surgery to remove gallbladder
body: I had keyhole surgery to remove my gallbladder. I woke up from surgery in quite alot of pain but the team were great, very informative, helpful and caring.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very happy with the care received
body: Thank you very much I was very happy with the quick response from my GP from the callback to the appointment offered  and the medication which was given to me

author: ADEMed
title: contacting the out patient orthopaedic clinic
body:
I had surgery last week and managed to knock my foot earlier today I called the hospital within a couple of minutes they said I could come up and they’d check it out despite not having an appointment  
I met the consultant and various other members of team there . They listened were sympathetic and very professional ordering an X-ray to check for no damage . Every single person I was in contact with today was amazing and I very much hope this this will be noticed and passed on as very positive feedback to all these people . Thank you is inadequate

author: ADEMed
title: Podiatrist at Blantyre Health Centre
body:
I’d like to commend a lady called Jean who is a podiatrist at Blantyre Health Centre .  
She has a been a great support during my protracted treatment whilst awaiting surgery  
A professional caring person who deserves for her help and work to be recognised . She’s also been a mentor to several students during my time as her patient and from my perspective she was also excelling in this aspect of her work

title: Consistently Excellent Service
body:
We joined this surgery some time ago because, like many others who have transferred to Wyncroft Surgery, even though we live in Little Baddow, we were appalled by the poor quality of service at the local practice. We are continually delighted with the courtesy, efficiency and care given by ALL members of this excellent practice. 
Thank you so much.

title: I felt valued and cared for.
body: Having day surgery for a gynaecology issue, I was extremely nervous and anxious. However EVERY member of staff made me feel comfortable. The bedside manner from Nurses to Dr's was exemplary. I had my needs met without even having to ask. I had talked about my anxiety and the reasons why in my initial consultation. While being taken to the operation room, I was informed they had done their best to give me an all female team. I was so touched by this. This immediately helped reduce my anxiety. Not that I think the staff would have known the impact that left. THANK - YOU! From the Anesthetic team who showed empathy and reassurance without making me feel like a problem or silly for having such emotions right through to the recovery ward staff. They were attentive and equally amazing at making the experience one that even with chronic wind pain left me with a feeling of dignity and respect. With each department that I went through during the day the staff were friendly and approachable. Checking on how I was feeling, to making sure I asked for help when I required it. Thank you to the staff who greeted me at the entrance right down to the Nurse who saw me out. Management should know that each and every staff member were praiseworthy and must be commended on a job well done. Please make sure that this department know how well they did, especially given how anxious I was when I went in.

title: Good customer service by reception staff
body:
Newly arrived and registered GP by generated NHS no. Service.  Phoned to Clinic for procedures and staff picked up
call with timely manner.  
Passed relevant documentation and new NHS no. Being generated by a week fulfilled their commitment.
Efficient & professional customer services by reception staff are fully recommended!

author: Our story
title: She instantly started to reassure me
body:
Today I went for an MRI at antrim hospital- it wasn’t until I was sitting in the waiting room drinking contrast that I realised the enormity of the experience.. of how the results could completely change your life… through my crazy thoughts the fabulous radiographers voice came through. Maybe she saw the fear in my face…  
Maybe she is always reassuring but she instantly started to reassure me and give me an outline of what was going to happen. Even in the scary cold room she made a point of checking with me and her colleague was equally as caring. I am very grateful.  
I also want to acknowledge the staff at the coffee bar- I was still a bit anxious after the test and decided to get a coffee. The lady at the coffee bar was so very friendly and a chat with her about the weather and the price of diesel was enough to settle my mind- for this I am also equally as grateful  
… now just to wait for results.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Fantastic treatment and staff
body:
I recently had surgery at Dewsbury hospital 
to  remove ovarian cyst. I had surgery in ward 12 and stayed in ward 14. The hospital was spotlessly clean everywhere. The staff were incredible and made me feel comfortable and safe throughout and I cannot thank then enough. All the staff were attentive, friendly, caring and I felt I was treated with respect and dignity throughout my stay. Thank you

author: aadie
title: Attending Perth royal infirmary for a colonoscopy
body:
I was so nervous before my appointment however was greeted by a friendly calm receptionist who swiftly dealt with my admission details  
I was then taken to a room and cared for exceptionally well both nurses who were so understanding when I didn’t feel too well.  
The procedure was explained fully and I was kept comfortable and dignified at all times.  
The staff made this experience a positive one and they were all so friendly and caring towards me and all of the other patients attending.

readBy.name: Office of Murdo Fraser, MSP for Mid Scotland & Fife

title: Fantastic receptionist
body: I came in this morning to sort out an appointment for a child I'm worried about. It was all proving a bit tricky but the receptionist sorted it all out for me and I'm so grateful. The doctors here are fantastic too - couldn't ask for better care.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Amazing nurses on ward 2
body: The food has been great, there have been a few meals that were not the best but that could just be me. Overall, I have enjoyed most of the things that I’ve had. The nurses are absolutely amazing, honestly cannot fault them. Cleanliness is also very very good and at a very high standard.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: very relaxed
body: Lurgan hospital is great, I am feeling very comfortable and relaxed here. Today will be nearly a week since I arrived from Craigavon. The nurses are so so lovely, they do their very best. The cleaners are doing a fabulous job.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Food not great on ward 3
body: The food has not been great, I don’t mind breakfast as I can just have cereal and some tea although the menu has not got much selection and I feel like I am always having to eat the same meals. The dinner time meals I think are too early, although that may just be me as I was always used to having my diner after 6.30pm.The nurses are lovely and the ward is kept very very clean.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Professional and friendly
body: I moved to this practice about 3 years and every since encounter has been very satisfactory. Staff are efficient, friendly and professional at all times.

author: Glorious
title: Helped me know when I could return to work
body: When I tested positive I received a call and it was very helpful and informative. It helped me to make the right decisions and to know when I could return to work

author: Dg1986
title: Made to feel welcome and comfortable
body: Very anxious to come in for surgery, but was put at complete ease, all staff were so kind caring reassuring and genuinely lovely kind hearted professionals. I was made welcome & comfortable.The ward was clean & covid safe. I was checked on regular, never waited long for pain relief, nothing was too much trouble to anyone. Had several stays in hospital recently but this ward is the best I have yet to come across. Made my anxious stay an actual pleasure. Highly recommended! Thankyou soo soo much!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Hmum90
title: 2 year old daughter with autism.
body:
We had to make an emergency visit due to nursery being unsure if my daughter had swallowed a magnet or not.  
When called in for the initial checks I informed the heath care assistant about my daughters needs and that she doesn’t understand, also that she may find it difficult and resit certain things that need carrying out.  
The health care assistant was so understanding and amazing with my daughter. She interacted with her, was calm and my little girl even was happy to be held by her for a short time. This is the first time we have completed a heart rate check using her hands! We normally have to use her toes.  
The experience in a Hospital can be very overwhelming for my daughter, especially being around unfamiliar people and having them touch her.  
I don’t normally leave reviews but I really appreciate how we were treated especially my daughter.

title: Fantastic treatment
body:
I had cataract surgery on my right eye at the Stockton practice and I can't fault the service.  From the gentleman on the door to the nursing and admin staff, they were friendly, proficient and caring.  I felt as if I was a person, not just a number.  Nothing was too much bother and they were happy to answer any questions, however trivial, I had.
Can't wait to have the left eye done!

title: Did I go on holiday?!
body:
I had a consultation, followed by an ultrasound, a further consultation, a camera/biopsy, more consultation and gall bladder removal.  This was all done and completed several months before the NHS even sent me a letter advising of my ultrasound appointment in over a months' time.  
The staff were amazing - it said I can't name anyone but the ones I saw and the one who did the operation I cannot thank enough - they were fabulous.
It didn't stop there - the nurses and support staff - even the cooks - were all very attentive, had great attention to details and gave me full confidence in the facility and its offerings.  
If it wasn't for the fact that my gallbladder was being removed I could have easily been on holiday.
I have experienced other local private hospitals, but in future this will be my location of choice.  Cannot recommend it highly enough.

title: Consistently outstanding
body: The entire team at the Lodge Surgery are consistently outstanding. They are friendly and welcoming. The team respond to calls within a couple of minutes and always make time for an appointment as needed. Thank you. Please continue the excellent work.

author: weemac3685
title: What a nurse she was; happy, friendly, caring
body:
I was a day patient at the Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy. I was cared for by a number of hospital staff, from the consultant who carried out my operation, the anaethesist (Lucy) and her colleagues who kept me alive, the nurses who cared for me before and after my operation, to the nursing support staff who brought me my tea and toast during recovery from the general anaesthetic . Each and everyone of them were fantastic, caring, supportive and genuinely interested in my treatment and care. Bobby was first point of contact and what a nurse she was; happy, friendly, caring and a shining example of what our NHS is about. Amy was my last point of contact and thanks to her for showing me off the premises.  
Thanks to everyone for my treatment and care, you're a credit to your profession.

author: Jbee1979
title: We didn't get a call but my daughter did
body:
I had covid in November 2021, I didn't get a call, I had to fill in my details online.  
It was really difficult because I was feeling so unwell. I had a call for my daughter, and gave the adviser my details too.  
He was surprised I hadn't had a call. My husband got covid in March 2022, there was no call, no follow up. I thought we were still contact tracing presently?

title: Extremely poor
body:
I feel the surgery is unfair at the moment as You can't leave a request for advice on line not only from gp but anybody after about 8.30/9am as you just get a recording or message saying the practice is full to capacity. It's like you can't be ill during the day. This has been like this for many months. Surley more Staff required, or limit patients in practice by not excepting new one's.
I used to be really happy with the way the surgery was run, now I feel it is a shambles, and my self and family are very disappointed.  😞

title: Honestly looked like an unregistered practice!
body:
I visited the Stratford upon Avon site which is within a larger building unit. After asking someone there I was pointed to what looked like a staff door in the surgery cafe. There were hand written signs stuck to doors. Reception was empty so noone booking people in. I was called be someone who looked to be a nurse and seemed professional given the surroundings and taken into a room and introduced to "the dermatologist" I don't usually comment on people but when your mask is skewd on your face and you keep on looking at the back of the room behind a patient it is very disconcerting. I was told my mole would be scrapped off which sounds quite bad and that it would be done in that room. An empty half finished room I cannot imagine being clean or sterile enough for any proceedure.
The whole thing gave me the feeling of a pop up back street fake clinic that won't be there next week... I am really really uncomfortable at the thought of going back and will be discussing this with my GP.

title: Coronary Care
body: I attend on Monday the 28th Having a heart attack. I was taken straight in and Care was given the staff were very kind and patient and explain things a few times without it seeming to be an issue. I was place in the Coronary care Unit were the nurses and other staff made me welcome and very calm. Even at 3 am in the morning when I was panicking they kept calm re assured me. I cant praise them highly enough then I went to another ward 304 were the staff were good and friendly I was only there one night so cant really comment on this ward. Then they arranges lift home with an amazing driver

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Simply rude and confusing department directions
body: I attended the urgent treatment care centre at Watford General hospital. First of all the directions around the hospital to urgent treatment and A&E are so confusing. When asking the receptionist where we are to go the staff member was very rude and appeared agitated by the fact we were unsure if we were in the correct place. They then were very rude because the phone number was incorrect on the records and it needed changing. Clearly the extra work was an inconvenience. We accepted that it was busy and that the hospital is running on low staff at present however this should not then affect the level of manners and politeness that is given to patients who are unwell. It’s an extra undue stress that’s not needed. The staff checking in patients were not approachable and other patients commented on how rude this staff member was. They spoke extremely loud so everyone could hear confidential information and it’s simply not professional. Very disappointed ☹️

title: Difficulty getting an appointment
body: My clinical matter was not immediate so I submitted an eConsultation form online. However, this was submitted to the surgery six days ago and I have not heard back despite sending reminders via the link provided in the email. I have since logged onto the NHS app at 7pm on the dot to book a appointment, however after selecting a time slot, I was asked to select another appointment as it was already taken, at which point no other appointments were available.

author: mature golfer
title: Very prompt referral, test and feedback
body:
Following chest discomfort, my GP arranged for blood tests.  
When I received my feedback about the blood tests (all good) I mentioned that the chest discomfort had persisted. My GP recommended that I have a cardio treadmill test.  
The call from my GP was on Thursday morning. I was contacted by the 'treadmill test' team on Thursday afternoon, and an exploratory phone call was booked for Friday afternoon. Following that phone call I was given an appointment for the treadmill test on Tuesday morning.  
I attended the treadmill test and was well looked after by staff who put me at ease. In less than an hour, I went through the cardio test and was given verbal feedback (which was very reassuring) by the charge nurse.  
She further explained that I would have a follow-up phone appointment with my GP in approximately two weeks once her report was received by the GP practice.  
At a time when the media seem highlight only 'bad news stories' about NHS Scotland, I feel strongly that this very 'good news story' should be highlighted.

title: Excellent Care
body: I want to commend you on the excellent care given to me yesterday during my MOT. Nothing was too much trouble, and the care was provided in a caring, professional, friendly and relaxed way. New, previously unknown issues were identifed, advice sought regarding next steps and the necessary steps put in place for future care and investigations.Please pass on my thanks to this exeptional member of staff.

title: Excellent practice
body:
I have been registered with this GP practice for more than 10 years and I have received exceptional clinical care and emotional support. 
I have recently been going through a lot of issues and needed extra support from my GP. My GP is the most caring, supportive, polite, highly competent GP. I have been treated with dignity, kindness and respect. He has a fantastic manner, he was checking on me how is my health, made me feel comfortable. He is very reassuring and approachable. 
The reception staffs are always friendly and accommodating. I was given clear instructions how to use Patient Access and book appointments; a great system where you can go online and complete e-consultation. It has been great, very efficient and you receive a call and a face to face is arranged after if needed. I was able to make appointments at the time that suites me and I have been seen when needed.
All the staff are so helpful, they all work hard and always have time to make you feel welcome. They go out of their way to accommodate you.

author: Beckyboo55
title: Why I am not under a specialist?
body:
I was under orthopaedic 4 year ago cervical spondylosis in the neck. The consultant discharged me 2017. I got rushed in with back pain and leaking urine at Macclesfield I saw the same consultant again , I said you saw me in 2017, they told me that they didn’t  
I asked for an xray on my hips but this consultant said no again. So I ask my doctors xray on hips and ankle and I wad diagnosed with osteoarthritis on all of them. The consultant has wrote on my letters I have severe dish and ostarthritis so why have they and the rest discharged me?  
I thought nhs keep people like me under a specialist until you get sorted, not thrown out? Disgusting service at Stepping Hill, I want it investigation into why. I am a human not a number.

title: Great service
body: My four year old grandson was unfortunately poorly this week. My daughter was unable to get through on the telephone as lines were busy. As we were concerned I drove up to the surgery to see if I could arrange an appointment. I gave the history of symptoms and the receptionist suggested that we should call 999. The GP in the building at the time advised that this would be the correct course of action. My daughter, who also has 2 other children under 5, preferred for my grandson to see the GP initially. Within the hour he was seen by the GP and an ambulance was called. Thankfully my grandson was discharged from hospital during the day following tests. We are totally grateful and appreciative of the support and service from the practice. The receptionist remained calm and caring throughout. Many thanks to you all.

title: Terrible practice
body:
Every single month without fail, I put in a repeat prescription via Phillips Chemist who then email Somerset Gardens with the request.  Every single month, without fail the surgery either don't send it to the chemist or they send it to their in-house chemist or they send the wrong medication. I have to call each time, spend at least an hour arguing with the prescription service (if you can call it a service) who either are really apologetic and tell me they'll put it through as an emergency to the chemist, or that they haven't received the request or that the medication isn't on repeat or that I've had the medication yet then still send it or they're incredibly rude.. It's March, put the request in on the 25th March, the surgery acknowledged it on the 28th March yet lo and behold, its not at the chemist.  The chemist have given me a print out of the request they submitted. I called the surgery again (on hold for 40 minutes as per usual) to be told they haven't received  the request, yet I have it in my possession.  They have told me after 30 minutes of going backwards and forwards that they'll call me back. The incompetency is shocking. I won't even start on the  attitudes of the receptionists.
Update: got a call back, told the medication would be in the chemist...its not. The chemist said to try again tomorrow.  I'm now out of chemo medication. Avoid this GP surgery. You've been warned

title: 1 in the queue for 13 minutes
body: Is there anyone there who can pick the phone up? So strange! You need a new phone system because this isn’t working for you

title: Appointment system
body: You can only ring after 10.30 for a non urgent appointment which is fine only you when you do phone back you are in a long queue which is is no good when you work and only get half an hour lunch as you are still on hold? Call after 5pm to be told there is nothing to ring back after 10.30 the following day! No wonder patients get irate its absolutely useless

title: 90 min waiting
body: Unbelievable! Had to wait 90 min in phone queue just to wait to speak to a receptionist to make an appointment. A nurse is going to phone back in five hours at the earliest. Frustration and aggravation followed which did not improve my well-being which was already at rock bottom. Please sort out your booking system, It’s not working! No wonder people resort to A&E!

title: Bad service
body: The reception team are rude and unhelpful. The system to get an appointment is really difficult and it has impacted my mental health and the general health of my children. I have just been told I am unable to get an appointment for my 2 years old for a least a month when they texted me yesterday to requested I make an appointment. I am currently changing GP.

title: Very hard for parents to get an appointment
body:
Healthcare at the Borchardt is excellent but it's so incredibly hard to get an appointment, especially for parents of young children who are walking small children to school, trying to keep them safe on the roads, every week day at 8.30. 

Today it took me 115 calls over 24 minutes to get through to reception. They had no face to face appointments left. 

I understand that some system is needed for allocating appointments but there are three big problems with the current 'phone at 8.30' model:

1. Parents with school or nursery age children, people who work nights and many others find it extremely difficult to sit by the phone repeatedly calling at 8.30am. There needs to be another way to see a medic. It is not safe to be making repeat phone calls while walking a four year old plus baby to school.

2. We then have to be ready to accept a phone call at any time that morning. That is unrealistic for tonnes of people, including people who can't answer calls all the time, i.e. those who work in call centres, social care, healthcare or education, and many others. If you miss the doctor's call, you usually have to start the whole nightmare of trying to get an appointment all over again the next day. If you do take the call and the doctor then wants to see you, this is very hard if you don't work from home - a teacher can't just leave her class with no notice, etc. There needs to be a way to agree an appointment time at the time of booking and ideally to be able to book a few days ahead sometimes so that life can be planned around it.

3. There clearly just are not enough appointments for everyone that needs them, and this calling system is an unofficial and arbitrary form of rationing. Many people will give up before reaching call 115 (or more), not because they don't need help but because they are too ill to stick at it or have other responsibilities that they cannot leave for so long. Many others get turned away if they call a little later. I know there is an NHS funding crisis but it is important that you understand just how many people are seeking healthcare and being turned away, without it ever being recorded as they never even get through on the phone. This can lead to people getting help much too late.

I would be grateful if you could consider how you can open up more appointments at the Borchardt and how you can allow people with varied circumstances to access healthcare if this 8.30 calling system doesn't work for them.

Many thanks otherwise for the excellent care and service from all your staff.

Laura

title: More organisation needed
body: My experience of derby royal A&E is not good after sitting there this week for 14 hrs , in my opinion you need to be triaged as you walk in it would probably of cut my time down by half  giving the time to more urgent cases , i understand there is a shortage of medical staff who were all doing an amazing job from what I could see , receptionist not so good quite rude and no compassion. Somebody needs to go and sit in the department & monitor what is happening, it’s very uncomfortable the seats are metal & no good for the length of time you are waiting especially for the elderly. I know it’s not easy but I’m sure little changes could be made.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Did not help
body: Range re medication query fir my 86 year old mum. Has nomad boxes. Will run out of 1 tablet next week which is not in the box. Receptionist who answered didn’t have a clue Fobbed me off. Waited over 50 minutes in a queue to be answered to be felt with in 2 minutes. Back to square one !!!

title: Useless
body: This practice is totally useless...you stay 1 hour in a queue and then they just say to call the day after cause they finish the appoiment for today...what is the sense of this??? I have to kepp calling everyday and pray basically...totally totally useless u should close this awful clinic

title: Poor patient service
body:
This surgery does not care for the patient. My repeat prescription has been always delayed for a week or so, and yet on their website, it says the prescription will be ready for collection after 48 hours. 
I am not sure how this surgery scored CQC's rating Good. My personal experience is awful.

author: gw79
title: Lack of understanding on the ward
body: Initially when I arrived at Hollingworth Mental Health ward I was subject to 4 days isolation in my room as I was told they had a Covid outbreak recently. They took a swab when I arrived and was told that it would take about 24 hours to check that I was Covid negative. I wore my mask at ALL times both going to meals and getting a brew. I ate my meals in my room but was constantly harassed by one nurse who complained if I just went to make a drink myself while wearing my mask. I complained about this person's overbearing behaviour to another nurse. A text message arrived confirming I was Covid negative and I told a nurse on the late shift the same day who reaffirmed I was Covid negative and that I was free to go out of my room. The following day I approached the first nurse about the text message and was told that the message had not come from them, so I would have to continue to isolate. I felt like I was being treated this way because I had complained. The whole time I felt ill at ease and it was like pulling teeth asking some of the staff to help you with something. It seemed to me that it was ok for some of the staff to be rude to you but, if you were rude to them they let you know about it. Requests were frequently ignored and if they did something for you it was often at staff's leisure or not at all. Staff seemed to spend a lot of their time in the ward office and didn't appear to be doing anything. One particular time I was in the common area in front of the ward office and the door was ajar and I could hear the staff openly talking about patients in a very derogatory manner, they abruptly shut the door when they realised people could hear them. One day I saw my name was on the notice board for a ward round the following day. On that day I asked if I could go to my flat to wash my clothes as the dryer on the ward had been broken since I first got there. I was reminded that I had a ward round. I left the ward early in the morning and walked back to my flat as it was only 10 mins away. I washed and dried ALL my dirty clothes as I wanted to be presentable at my ward round and even repaired holes in my socks and repaired a pocket on my jeans. I returned to the ward before noon and was signed back in by one of the nurses. I then waited in my room for an hour assuming a nurse would call me for my ward round meeting with the ward psychiatrist. No meeting came and I then sat in front of the ward office for another hour expecting to be called to the ward round office, all the time suffering from tension and anxiety. I asked someone in the ward office, and was told my ward round was cancelled and rescheduled for a later date. No one who had seen me had had the decency to tell me at that it had been cancelled. I was left sitting there becoming ever more anxious and tense. As I was leaving the ward I spoke with a member of staff, and I told them how I had been treated during my stay. They seemed visibly disturbed about their colleagues behaviour! The whole time I was on the ward I felt like I was in a prison camp. My biggest worry as a tax payer is that my money is ill spent on this ward where the staff don't seem to know how their lack of understanding and their behaviour affects individuals. I feel that someone needs to look into how the ward is run. My whole experience on the ward was that it was not fit for purpose for someone with a mental health problem.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Emmrd63
title: Support
body: Wow, Peter is so good at his work, thank you so much for being there and thank you so much for hearing me and advocating for me to have the depot reduced, you are a star. I forgot to ask him too and I am not heard, maybe now you can see why!

author: Sarzz74
title: They made a horrible situation that bit easier
body: My 2 year old son contracted COVID and had a febrile seizure. This was an awfully scary time but thankfully he is ok. The ambulance staff who attended our home were amazing with him and when we arrived in ED, despite it being very busy, crowded and under pressure, my son was treated like he was the only person in the department. The staff were all amazing and made a horrible situation that bit easier. The paediatric doctor on duty that night was amazing, very reassuring and again, made the situation that bit easier. Thank you to all!!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tita
title: Quicker access
body:
The aggressor factor was eliminated. On another aspect I was struggling, the time is slowly healing.  
I still feel the trauma every time I think about the subjects.  
The support from Inclusion Thurrock was good. But it would have been better if it was quicker. I had to wait over 3 weeks to join the online self-learning project. This was the period that I was facing more difficulties to liaise with my mental health issues. My suggestion is to release the programme immediately and do the Therapeutic assistance later. And also for 1:1 programmes and group programmes, some online self-learning matérial could be shared, so the patient can start liaising with their difficulties other than wait for a Therapist or Counsellor to be available for them to have access to the programme.

author: Hodkinson87
title: Caring and professional
body: My partner had an emergency operation on due to a bowel perforation staff in A+E were wonderful with him. He has since been back to A+E for his mental health since having the surgery where he had a colostomy and ileostomy. When we arrived a wonderful RNA called Fallon came to see him in the waiting room as she recognised his name from being on D6 where she used to work. She is such a caring and professional young lady who is a credit to Stockport foundation trust. She went above and beyond and made me and especially my partner feel well cared for in his time of crisis when she didnt even need to see him as he wasnt her patient. I hope she continues to work her magic with her wonderful personality in A+E for many years to come. We will be forever grateful Fallon, thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

author: PGB
title: A great radiotherapy team
body: Under the care of the therapeutic radiographers for the last 5 weeks. Their professionalism, kindness and general empathy has been terrific. It gives confidence that the team is on your side, & that things can get better. A great team in a great centre, with superb oversight.

author: Vorhees
title: Very helpful
body: I went regarding some warts that i have got. It went really well was very helpful.

author: Charlotte86xx
title: Lovely nurse
body: The nurse was absolutely lovely. She made me feel at ease and did a splendid job of my implant removal. Great experience -what a lovely, kind lady!

author: Floes44
title: Humour and compassion
body: Visited A&E, was seen promptly and treated with care, humour and compassion throughout. Had follow up appointment with X-ray and again was seen quickly by lovely staff

author: DesDC
title: Fantastic people!
body: I attended Monklands Hospital today for a CT scan. The staff in radiography were so nice and made a somewhat uncomfortable and embarrassing scan, much less awful than I feared. So thank you so much, Ian, Phephile, Elaine and Ryan for looking after me so well today. Your approachable and friendly attitude is a great example of how to deliver a superb healthcare experience.

author: Propernutritiontohealallergiesarenotaburden
title: Food in hospital
body:
I have multiple food allergies. Our hospital provides hot meals up to a certain time and then only sandwiches are available. After being admitted from ED, I was offered a sandwich even though l disclosed my allergies! (It’s all over my file also!). I was made to feel like a nuisance! This is a hospital! Should cater for all allergies. I asked for a menu so I could assess the ingredients myself, but was told no more hot cooked meals available and all they had was pre-made sandwiches! I asked whether there was any salad and I was presented with a very sad looking wilting leafy salad without any protein. I asked for fruit to fill me up a bit more as I was so hungry!  
This is not acceptable! How can a hospital have no form of protein and plain vegetables available? I would have been over the moon with a chicken breast or mince with some plain vegetables,but was told this isn’t available! Shocking! The next day, my partner brought me some tinned tuna and snacks I could have, as I was offered a hot meal the next day, but all in sauces thickened with ingredients I’m allergic to. Not a good experience when a hospital can’t provide simple meals to allergic patients. A hospital is a place to heal, and nutrition is important! A sandwich as the only option sure isn’t proper nutrition to heal.  
[Unsure about 'Food']  
  
[Unsure about 'Staff attitude']

author: PolduPixie
title: Friendly and reassuring
body:
I received my dermatology day case appointment for treatment just three weeks after being seen and assessed at clinic. I had expected a much longer wait, possibly months, so this was very positive. The letter had clear instructions and I arrived, as directed, 15 mins ahead of procedure time. There was no wait and I was taken to the treatment room where the team of three nurses, Lisa, Clare and Janet went through the preliminary processes in a friendly and reassuring manner. Dr Hood explained everything clearly and the excision of a lesion on my leg was carried out painlessly and carefully. I cannot fault the organisation or the professionalism of the whole team. I was out in less than an hour and I am now at home, relaxing with feet up!  
Thanks, team, for your care today.

author: Debssy
title: Gallbladder removal and hernia repair
body: I have waited for this op for 3 years had 3 pre - ops, arranged time off work and for the people around me to care for me only to have these ops cancelled. I understand covid, but the pain daily doesn’t get better or the sickness episodes become more frequent and having to take time off work. I had recently been put on half pay and couldn’t afford it so have to return to work while I wait yet another appointment or pre-op. I spoke to the surgeon in early March, who said It will be done in 8 weeks, phoned for an update at the end of the month - another disappointment . This surgery not being priority at the min although I’m on priority list. Any advice on who I could contact would be much appreciated.

author: yellowze43
title: Incredible massages
body:
These massages have been incredible and really beneficial to my well-being. 
They have helped with sleep and relaxation. It is an absolute pleasure to have met Sarah who puts you at ease on your first meeting. She is very kind and confident and always checks on how you are feeling with the massages. 
For me it has been so helpful with my sleep and general well-being. 
Having some time for myself has been fantastic. I will so miss these now my sessions have finished at the Fern Centre. 
I am extremely grateful for time given by Sarah and the opportunity provided by the Fern Centre. 
Thanks so much, I am really grateful for the experience of some 'self care' in a safe environment. 
Always made so welcome and comfortable by everyone.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Granny C
title: Lovely staff on the wards
body: My dad attended A n E around 2 weeks ago following a fall at home. The staff were thorough, caring and informative and although he was there a few hours, the staff, both medical and nursing regularly checked in on him despite the pressures of a busy Department. He was admitted to SAU overnight before being transferred to ward 22 the following morning for 8 or so days. He sustained significant injuries requiring observation but thankfully no surgery! Both the staff nurse from SAU was attentive and understanding to my dads needs (a dementia patient). In ward 22, equally the staff were fantastic, understanding our families concerns and worries due to limited visiting! Susan, the Charge Nurse was great with my mum, explaining everything and kept her and my dad informed! Caroline, (the SCN), you have a wonderful team! Our only negative was on my dads discharge, although my mum had taken clothes for my dad to change into, he was instead, discharged in his pyjamas on a cold night with no jacket on! However, other than that we cannot fault ward 22! Amazing team, thank you!

author: Lisadavil8
title: My recent attendance at the clinic
body:
At the very outset from the contact with the receptionist who made the phone call to advise me of my apt. I was treated with courtesy, helpfulness and politeness. On my arrival for apt the staff every member of the team treated me with the utmost respect ,professionalism, charm and above all as an individual in whom they were interested.  
I met ancillary staff, nursing staff, professional’s allied to medicine the Doctor in charge, each and every one the Trust should be extremely proud of. Having worked in the health service myself for almost 40 years I left feeling very proud of the service provision in that facility.  
A very sincere and heartfelt thanks to them Representing the Best

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Angela Dust
title: Great friendly staff
body: Always feel comfortable when going great friendly staff the nurse that i saw today was fantastic he really was good at what he does.

author: sunwe35
title: Coil removed
body: I had my coil removed. The doctor was really kind and informative. Thank you

author: Volunteer1945
title: So impressed by the care and attention
body:
From the moment I was taken to theatre, I was immediately SO impressed by the care & attention I received from the all the nurses & especially Dr Young. I had been really anxious prior to this & and after having to receive a  
nephrostomy bag during the procedure I got very upset & emotional, the nurses never left my side & Dr Young was amazing and talked me through the whole thing. He reassured me by confirming he would get me back in again at a later date to try & take the bag away. I received that appointment date before being discharged. I couldn’t have got through this without every one of them and will feel more relaxed at my next appointment.

title: Excellent Care
body:
I would just like to congratulate and thank all of your staff who have recently dealt with a health issue that I have.

Often people are very quick to slate our NHS service but I for one am extremely grateful that we have such a remarkable
service. ALL of your staff from my initial contact to the two doctors  have been polite, professional and have put my mind at ease and responded to my concerns extremely quickly. I would like you to pass on my gratefulness and thanks and assure them that patients do recognise what a challenging and demanding job it can be, and that we do appreciate it when our concerns are dealt with as quickly and professionally as mine has been.

title: Awful service
body: Wife rang in the morning needing an appointment said to the receptionist 3 times for it to be a female doctor which the receptionist said that it is with a female doctor when my wife got there to her appointment told which room to wait for then her name got called she went to the room and low and behold the doctor was a male even though my wife stated 3 times on the phone for a female and the receptionist even said it was

title: Friendly and speedy service.
body: Suffering hay fever induced asthma attack, got in touch with surgery for advice around 8 a.m. Was contacted by a GP and following comprehensive questioning was prescribed and advised to collect prescription later in the morning.Thank you.

title: Great staff but awful organisation/management
body:
I have used this hospital for myself, and both of my sons.  
Every time I book the appointments there is an issue - we have even turned up to be told that it the appointment was cancelled.  I have had an appointment that I wasn't informed about (they did rearrange it very quickly for me).  
The latest debacle is with my son who was due to have surgery today - we had a phone call at 8pm last night advising it was cancelled because one of the staff has decided they are unhappy with some of the data - data that has been available to them for MONTHS being as it has been previously cancelled due to him contracting Covid at Christmas.  even then he got as far as a pre surgery appointment because they gave out the incorrect info regarding enforced time lapse from Covid to operation.
Although I have always found the staff extremely nice I will be looking elsewhere for future private care - I have used 2 other local private hospitals and NEVER had any of the issues that seem to be constant here.  A thorough systemic review is needed I think.

title: Awful practice
body: The receptionist staff are unhelpful and rude, and refuse to let you speak to management. They only let you book telephone consultations, which sometimes come and sometimes don't. I have never had a physical examination here for as long as I've been registered. Worst GP surgery I've ever had, sadly.

title: Amazing Staff
body:
I have been treated by the gynaecology team for 6 weeks.  Everybody, without exception has been so kind, caring & professional; from the early calls with waiting list advisors, appointment arrangement  through to radiography, scans & day surgery. I could not have asked for better treatment.  When this sort of care is across the board, it's testament to the ethos of the hospital.  I'm also very grateful to a registrar in general surgery, who saw a problem outside of their area, and referred me on very quickly.
Finally, the consistently clear communication & diagnosis is much appreciated
Thank you to all at the Lister - just great

title: Caring, dedicated practice
body: In these very difficult times where the NHS is stretched beyond what is acceptable, I am very impressed by the staff and doctors of Mount Avenue Surgery.  Whilst occasionally things aren't straight forward, this practice really does offer excellent levels of service and will always (in my experience) try and sort things out for you, as they did with me this week. Yes, staff are incredibly busy but sometimes patients need to be a little more patient and remember that staff, nurses and doctors work are really trying their best to do a good job and provide the best care and support they can, juggling everyone's needs.

title: Rubbish
body: I've been trying to get to see or speak to doctor since Sunday ended up calling an ambulance 3 day later, they told me to get a gp appointment, not a cat in hello chance of that happening by time I get through there no appointments, so this morning I went to speak to them in person, can't get an appointment in person I explained the situation told them and what hospital told me to do but they will get someone to contact me a week later. By that time I could be dead thankyou for nothing erdington medical centre.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Understanding of my symptoms very much appreciated, quick to acknowledge my concerns thank you , well recommended doctors practice

title: Nice polite staff
body: Easy going visit, no problems helpful with enquiry about inoculation s.——-///////.————————————————-————-

title: Fantastic practice and staff
body:
I cannot thank this practice enough, Always helpful and polite. Even under the extreme pressures we have been having I have nothing but praise for the practice. 

Thank you again, you are all doing an amazing job!

title: Great service.friendly helpful staff
body: I have nothing but praise for this service.supplies arrive on time and any small gliches have been sorted out really quickly after a short phone call.please keep up the good work.you make having a stoma so easy.

title: Left in a freezing waiting area
body: Arrived at the hospital for an appointment.  And was told to take a seat in the main hospital waiting area in the freezing cold

title: Pharmacist Phone Call
body: A review of my medications which I thought of as a ‘ must do ‘ instead became a caring , informative and extremely helpful conversation. The pharmacist ( unfortunately I didn’t get her name) has even gone out of her way to follow up some questions with my GP . Wonderful professional service, thank you.

title: Great practice
body: Was seen earlier than my given appointment.. sorted the issue very quickly and was over all a good experience.. very polite staff and clean environment

title: What's up with your telephone system?
body: Cannot get through on the telephone. If I'm lucky enough to get in the queue I keep getting cut off or put through to an extension that just rings without being answered. The website for GP/receptionist   consult isn't available until 10am and doesn't always allow GP access and would be too late for that days appointments. The only option is to visit the surgery in the hope of getting some help, this isn't always viable and shouldn't be how I get access to medical services.

title: Great staff/Covid patients/complaints form…
body:
Doctors, nurses and support staff are wonderful, caring, supportive and helpful. First rate.

If you have Covid as a patient you are placed last on the list for any procedure which inevitably means you get knocked off eg. angiogram, mri etc.

Complaints procedure is worthless. Emailed and used online forms. Supposed to be contacted within 2 working days and have heard nothing after a week. Useless!!!

title: Antenatal clinic: very rude staff
body:
I went for an appointment with the obstetrician and they were very unpleasant in reception. They make you feel as if you are bothering them…
The scan department in the second floor were very nice.

readBy.name: Homerton University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Resolved issue
body: Recently joined this surgery, I booked 2 appointments and there was a slight miss communication which lead to me attending on the wrong date/time. I spoke to the practice manager who was very helpful to review the call and understand miss communication and resolve the issue, he was able to book another appointment at a convenient time. The receptionist who I booked the appointments with was very friendly and helpful. My first experience at the surgery started badly, but after help from the practice manager all was resolved very quickly and it improved my experience tremendously. Thank you

title: Good Surgery
body:
The last 2 years have been very challenging with covid being around.
I have in the past called this practice for lack of appointments. While waiting to be seen by the GP I took note of what was going on. the reception staff are run off their feet, call after call, people at the door complaining. I for one will never complain again. The staff are human beings just like you and me. The abuse they got was unblievable and that was in a short time i was sat waiting. Please be kind, they are doing the best they can. hats off to you all. Hope you are all well. keep safe. Thank you

title: Felt like I was a nuisance
body: Had a telephone consultation and was left feeling very upset and made to feel I’d wasted the Drs time will be looking for new GP

title: Lovely staff
body: I am suffering from long covid every time I speak to receptionists they are so helpful also when I have had to see practice nurses and Doctors or speak over the phone they are always understanding and helpful I have just spoke to receptionist who was very kind and polite

title: Brilliant practice
body: Can't fault the staff at this surgery, and that goes for the receptionists as well as the doctors and nurses. Very understanding and accommodating and doing a brilliant job despite the hardships faced over the past couple of years.

title: Kind and Helpful
body:
I had a telephone call today from one of the Buttercross GP’s as I had concerns about a change in medication. 
The GP that called me was kind, helpful and patient. Listened to my concerns, checked that I understood everything and that I had no further questions before we finished. 
I cannot fault this service.

title: Great service all round!
body:
I attended A&E with a fractured foot and from the moment I arrived to the moment I left the people were lovely and the service I received was excellent.
I was met at the main entrance by a man from the chaplaincy who got my a wheelchair and took me to A&E. In A&E I was seen by a lovely doctor, a lovely radiologist, and a lovely lady who fitted me with a moon-boot. On my way out of the hospital another member of staff chatted with me and made a joke. The staff all seemed happy and were lovely to me.
I was in and out in 2 hours which I think is pretty amazing as A&E was really busy, so thank you!

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: fantastic caring attitude
body: I came to the Wirral for a pre-operative assessment and was greeted with care and professionalism. I then had my first experience of eye surgery on my left eye. This has turned our extremely well and my quality of life has been improved. My thanks go out to the SpaMedica staff at both Birkenhead and Newcastle-under-Lyme, you are professional,  caring and very supportive, together you have change my life for the better. Thank you all  so much. I am watching snooker at the moment and it is so clear it is hard to believe. My best wishes to you all. Hugh

title: Great practice
body: The doctors and staff at this practice are highly recommended. My situation was very well understood and listened to. I was given great advice, appropriate medication and felt fully supported throughout my illness. Just wanted to show my appreciation and say a very big thank you.

title: Outstanding Service
body:
This morning I attended the hospital's Inhealth Endoscopy Unit where I was seen by a Endoscopist and a team of highly professional nurses. From the initial meeting when forms were completed and procedures explained, and options given, through to the transnasal examination (scope via my nose passage) I received exemplary service far exceeding my expectations. I must give special credit to the nurses for their calm and professional service and their reassuring manner which put me immediately at ease. Although the Endoscopist had a tight schedule for today's appointments he gave me detailed explanations of his procedures and diagnoses, with advice and comments. The complete procedure took approximately 15 minutes and was concluded by a personal copy of a comprehensive report which will be sent to my GP. And which I could understand.
Thank you so much to this team wonderful team of caring professionals.
Why go private when the NHS provides such outstanding service?
